intro: Cyrtandra homoplastica, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its elliptical, often hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Cyrtandra homoplastica is known for its morphological variability, which has led to confusion in its taxonomic classification.
